meanings.definition: A monetary unit equal to one hundredth of a franc in France and other countries.
meanings.sent1: In France, you can buy a baguette for a few centimes.
meanings.sent2: I found a few centimes in my pocket and used them to buy a candy bar.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel saved up centimes to buy a tiny top hat for its acorn.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a million centimes.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the fountain was like a thousand centimes falling into a wishing well.

meanings.sent1: I found a centimes coin on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine only accepted centimes for the gumballs.
meanings.sent3: The pirate's treasure chest was full of shiny centimes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a handful of centimes, bright and infectious.
meanings.sent5: The old man's stories were like rare centimes, valuable and cherished.
